intro: Phyllactis macrorhiza var. pumila, commonly known as the small-leaf phyllactis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically features small, elliptical leaves arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent corona. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks.
